title: How to Make Burmese Sticky Rice Balls

steps.headline: Gather your ingredients.
steps.description: Make sure you don't miss anything!

steps.headline: Add water into the glutinous rice flour until the flour becomes sticky.
Roll the powder dough into 1 or 1/2 inch (25 mm or 12 mm) balls and fill them with the jaggery inside.
Put the balls in the boiling water.
steps.description: When you put the balls in the water, they will sink.

steps.headline: Take the balls out of the water when they come up to the surface.
Garnish the balls with ground coconut.

tyn: a package of glutinous rice flour - look for this at any Asian market
a bowl of jaggery (unrefined brown sugar), chopped
text: Gather your ingredients. Make sure you don't miss anything! Add water into the glutinous rice flour until the flour becomes sticky.  Chop the jaggery into pieces.  Roll the powder dough into 1 or 1/2 inch (25 mm or 12 mm) balls and fill them with the jaggery inside.  Put the balls in the boiling water. When you put the balls in the water, they will sink. Take the balls out of the water when they come up to the surface.  Garnish the balls with ground coconut.  Finished.
sentences: Make sure you don't miss anything!
Add water into the glutinous rice flour until the flour becomes sticky.
Roll the powder dough into 1 or 1/2 inch (25 mm or 12 mm) balls and fill them with the jaggery inside.
Put the balls in the boiling water.
When you put the balls in the water, they will sink.
Take the balls out of the water when they come up to the surface.
Garnish the balls with ground coconut.
